subject: AW: [junit] Suggestion: New addition to the Assert class
msgSnippet: You don t need this - your test methods may happily throw any Exception, which will generate a nifty error for your testcase.
messageBody:
You don't need this - your test methods may happily throw any Exception,
which will generate a nifty error for your testcase.

> -----Ursprungliche Nachricht-----
> Von: andy_ipaccess <andrew.mcdonagh@...>
> [mailto:andrew.mcdonagh@...]
> Gesendet: Montag, 3. Februar 2003 16:21
> An: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Betreff: [junit] Suggestion: New addition to the Assert class
>
>
> Most of my tests have a catch all, catch block, which simplay calls
> fail(e.toString());
>
> Can i suggest that the following fail() method be added for the next
> release.
>
>
> /**
> * Fails a test with the given message.
> */
> static public void fail(Exception e) {
> throw new AssertionFailedError(e.toString());
> }
>
> Seems to make the code cleaner, my 2cents
>
> Andy
